Event.0: American Democratic politician Geraldine Ferraro, who was the first woman to be nominated (1984) for vice president by a major political party in the United States, died at age 75.
Event.1: Sixteen years after being cancelled, the BBC sci-fi series Doctor Who returned to television with a new episode, with Christopher Eccleston appearing in the title role.
Event.2: Russian intelligence officer and politician Vladimir Putin was elected president of Russia.
Event.3: Police discovered the bodies of 39 members of Heaven's Gate, an American religious group that believed in unidentified flying objects; they had committed suicide in the belief that a spaceship was arriving to take them to a better place.
Event.4: Heavyweight boxing champion Mike Tyson was sentenced to six years in prison following a rape conviction in Indianapolis, Indiana.
Event.5: Paul McCartney and Stevie Wonder release the single "Ebony & Ivory" in the UK
Event.6:
Signing of Israel-Egypt peace treaty
The historic peace accord between Israel and Egypt, agreed to by Menachem Begin and Anwar el-Sādāt and negotiated by U.S. President Jimmy Carter at Camp David, Maryland, in September 1978, was signed this day in 1979.
Event.7:
Larry Page
American computer scientist and entrepreneur
was born
Event.8: LA Lakers break NBA wins record by winning 69 of 82 games (69-13), record will stand for 24 years
Event.9: Bangladesh (East Pakistan) under Sheikh Mujibur Rahman declares its independence from Pakistan
Event.10: Members of the Awami League set up a government-in-exile in Calcutta (Kolkata) and declared Bangladesh an independent state.
Event.11: Large-scale anti-Vietnam War protests take place in the United States, including in New York, Washington D.C. and Chicago
Event.12: Academy award-winning actor Yul Brynner (39) divorces actress Virginia Gilmore (40) after 15 years of marriage
Event.13: Dr Jonas Salk announces vaccine to prevent polio
Event.14: "Ugetsu", Japanese film directed by Kenji Mizoguchi, starring Masayuki Mori, Machiko Kyō and Kinuyo Tanaka, is released
Event.15: American pop singer and actress Diana Ross—who achieved international stardom, first as leader of the vocal group the Supremes and later as a solo artist—was born.
Event.16: First "Eichmann transport" to Auschwitz & Birkenau concentration camps
Event.17:
Richard Dawkins
British biologist and writer
was born
Event.18: British evolutionary biologist Richard Dawkins, who maintained that genes are the driving force of evolution and advocated atheism, was born in Nairobi, Kenya.
Event.19: Writer Walter Lippmann (48) weds second wife Helen Byrne Armstrong
Event.20:
Leonard Nimoy
American actor
was born
Event.21: Sandra Day O'Connor, the first woman to become a U.S. Supreme Court justice, was born in El Paso, Texas.
Event.22: The Mille Miglia, the famed automobile race across Italy, was inaugurated.
Event.23:
Pierre Boulez
French composer and conductor
was born
Event.24: American dramatist Tennessee Williams, whose plays reveal a world of human frustration in which sex and violence underlie an atmosphere of romantic gentility, was born in Columbus, Mississippi.
Event.25: In support of Mohammed Ali Shah's coup d'etat against the constitutional government in Persia, a Russian military force invades northern Persia to relieve the siege of Tabriz
Event.26:
Joseph Campbell
American author
was born
Event.27: The first clash of the Riel Rebellion in Canada took place in Duck Lake, Saskatchewan.
Event.28: American poet Robert Frost, much admired for his depictions of rural New England life and his realistic verse portraying ordinary people, was born in San Francisco.
Event.29: Municipal elections bring revolutionaries to power in Paris to form Commune government
Event.30: Italian general Giuseppe Garibaldi (34) weds Ana Maria de Jesus Ribeiro (20) in Montevideo
Event.31: Ludwig van Beethoven died of cirrhosis of the liver in Vienna.
Event.32: Earthquake measuring 7.7 on the Richter scale destroys 90% of Caracas, Venezuela and kills an estimated 15,000–20,000 people
Event.33: Political activist Thomas Paine (34) weds second wife Elizabeth Ollive
Event.34: Pope John XIX crowns Conrad II Holy Roman Emperor, founder of the Salian dynasty
